title: Cityscape at Dusk

nouns: The Sky is the portion of outer space or the atmosphere visible from a position within a world.
Everything that is above the surface of the Earth.
The atmosphere above a given point, especially as visible from the ground during the day.
The sky is everything that lies above the surface of the Earth, including the atmosphere and outer space.
The atmosphere and outer space as viewed from the earth
The part of the earth's atmosphere and space outside it that is visible from earth's surface. During the day it is perceived as blue, and at night as black.
Atmosphere above a point.
A building, esp. one of large size or imposing appearance.
A structure that has a roof and walls and stands more or less permanently in one place
Closed structure with walls and a roof.
Building
A building is a man-made structure with a roof and walls standing more or less permanently in one place.
Structure with a roof and walls, such as a house or factory.
A closed structure with walls and a roof.
A building; a structure; an architectural fabric, especially an imposing one; a large or fine building, public or private.
Man-made structure with a roof and walls standing more or less permanently in one place
A building to which there is free access by the public and which is available for the use of a community.
Daily disappearance of the Sun below the western half of the horizon
Time of day.
The daily disappearance of the Sun below the western half of the horizon
The time in the evening at which the sun begins to fall below the horizon
Sunset or sundown is the daily disappearance of the Sun below the western horizon, as a result of Earth's rotation.
The time of day when the sun disappears below the western horizon.
Sunset is the daily disappearance of the Sun below the horizon in the west as a result of Earth's rotation.
The descent of the sun below the western horizon in the evening.
Twilight is the time between dawn and sunrise, and the time between sunset and dusk.
A period of time at the end of the day shortly after sunset during which the light fades gradually.
Twilight, as at early morning or (especially) early evening; dusk
The darkest stage of twilight in the evening
Twilight.
Gloaming, twilight
The time when this light is visible; the period between daylight and darkness.
"Nightfall" is a 1941 science fiction short story by Isaac Asimov about the coming of darkness to the people of a planet ordinarily illuminated at all times on all sides.
A 1941 science fiction short story by Isaac Asimov, and later adaptations
The time of day immediately following sunset
A period of time occurring at the end of the day during which the sun sets.

Evenfall is the first short film in a series about a highly trained young woman embarking on her career as an international spy and discovering it takes more than good looks to keep things from falling into the wrong hands.
Dusk is the darkest stage of twilight in the evening.
The time between dawn and sunrise or between sunset and dusk
Twilight is the illumination of the Earth's lower atmosphere when the Sun itself is not directly visible because it is below the horizon.
Dusk, twilight
The close of the day; the coming of night.
A building over 10 stories tall
A skyscraper is a very tall, continuously habitable building.
A very tall building with many stories
A very tall building.
A skyscraper is a tall, continuously habitable building of many floors, usually designed for office, commercial and residential use.
Tall building
A very tall building with a great number of floors.
The line at which the sky and Earth appear to meet
A skyline is the artificial horizon that a city's overall structure creates.
The line at which the earth and sky meet, horizon.
The horizontal line that appears to separate the Earth from the sky.
Permanent settlement larger than a town, generally with a population of at least tens of thousands
Cities are relatively large and permanent settlement.
A city is a relatively large and permanent human settlement.
"Abide with Me" is a Christian hymn by Scottish Anglican Henry Francis Lyte most often sung to English composer William Henry Monk's tune entitled "Eventide".
Evening of the day.
Evening
The latter part of the day (the period of decreasing daylight from late afternoon until nightfall)
Period of the day between 5:00 pm and 9:00 pm
The evening before a certain day.
Evening is the period between the late afternoon and night when daylight is decreasing, around dinner time.
The time of the day between the approximate time of midwinter dusk and midnight (compare afternoon); the period after the end of regular office working hours.
That part of the day in which daylight decreases and the night falls.
Evening, night.
Evening.
Evening in its primary meaning is the period of the day between afternoon and night.

description: A view of city buildings as the last light disappears from the sky. An orange (or blue) glow lingers, before the stars of the night sky become visible.
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the cityscape at dusk emoji captures the tranquil beauty of urban lights emerging as the day fades. Silhouetted buildings with subtly illuminated windows are rendered with Appleâ€™s characteristic depth and realistic lighting, creating a soft, inviting glow against a gradient sky of deep purples and oranges. The emoji's smooth, rounded edges and gentle textures evoke a sense of peaceful transition and the quiet energy of a city settling in for the night, often used to signify evening activities or a sense of urban ambiance.
